message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is primarily focused on natural language processing (NLP) tasks, specifically on improving the generation of sentences through post-editing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a novel training framework that utilizes state-of-the-art generalized autoregressive pretraining methods, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper involves the use of probability estimation and execution of post-editing operations, which can be categorized under artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper also mentions the application of the proposed framework to text style transfer, which can be categorized under computer vision (cs.CV) as it involves the manipulation of text to change its visual appearance.
